posts.message:
[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZxB[/img][/align]

The edition you are currently reading is the [b][color=white]124th fu[/color][color=#FFF150]ll edition[/color][/b]. To read any older editions of HF News, please go [url=http://goo.gl/pxojJ]here[/url]. 

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZfF[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]YouTube Aw[/color][color=#FFF150]ard Frenzy[/color][/b]
This past week's site happenings have been dominated by the YouTube award. The simple combination of pixels that have rarely been given out for the past while has overflowed [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]'s already overflowing inbox. Hundreds of white and red boxes have been handed out to any member who fulfilled the easily fulfillable requirements given by Omniscient, including yours truly. The awards will no longer be given out as of today.

[b][color=white]Omniscient Chan[/color][color=#FFF150]ges His Avatar[/color][/b]
Site-owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has changed his avatar to ring in the new year today. The all-important symbol has been changed to a cartoonish replicate of Omniscient, very thin. This removes the serious-toned, hard-looking face of the past. The reception of his new avatar has yet to be seen. Presumably, this change is in order for a fresh start to a new year.

[b][color=white]Omniscient's S[/color][color=#FFF150]kype Stolen[/color][/b]
Site-owner [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#4DD0FC][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] quickly alerted vulnerable forum members this week after his Skype account was stolen. The account, HFOMNI, was apparently jacked through an exploit on Skype's end. Omniscient has stated that the account was inactive and he had no plans to use it in the future. However, he has passed on the information to Skype and has shown sufficient proof in order to retrieve the stolen account.

[b][color=white]Site Serve[/color][color=#FFF150]r Upgraded[/color][/b]
After weeks of unusually long downtime, the site's server has been updated. The site now has 48 GB of memory, according to a recent tweet by Omniscient. The reaction from this upgrade has already been visible, with downtime becoming minimal for site users.

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZX7[/img][/align]

¬†

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZso[/img][/align]
[size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][color=white]Interview -[/color] [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150]PubMaster[/color][/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: For the 124th edition of the HF News, we've rung our New Year's bells for PubMaster. What kind of New Year's Resolutions do you have for this year?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: First of all, hello. Also I would like to give a shout-out to all members of Respawn. Well, my resolutions is to go to the gym and acomplish more on HackForums. Also, I wanna get better grades at school, not saying they are the worst, but they could be better. Also, I wanna get back to swimming, which I used to do a lot back when I was a kid.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Do you swim for fun or competitively/sport?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: I do it for healthy life. Also, I didn't do it much competitively... It is more of a passion.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Sounds cool. I live by a lake and swim when I can too. How did you become detached from it?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Nice to hear. Well, I must say that school did it. I was really good in primary school and I didn't have time to do both. Also, I started gaming. I did a lot of CS 1.3 and later CS 1.6 back then, also went to WCG :)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Did you get into Respawn because of CS or was that something else?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Well, I was in Gamers before. I was really good friends with Mendacious which was the creator of Gamers. We used to game a lot and after a while I left HF so I could take a break. When I came back, a lot of old groups did not exist anymore. After that, I saw Respawn and I though I should apply. I didn't get accepted the first time I applied, but I got invited after that by Touch. I would like to thank Touch for inviting me to this great group.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Did Touch influence your rise to leadership, or was that something else?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Well, all of Respawn leaders were my role models. I was doing my best for the group, and I never thought I would become a leader. I was quite shocked when I received the news :)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: What do you think was a contributing factor, on your part?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Well, I helped members around, made a few great tutorials, also did giveaways in name of Respawn. Also, I got a sticky for my tutorial that I made in name of Respawn. We are currently doing a lot of tutorials for almost any gaming section on HF. There is a lot to come.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Any hints as to future events for Respawn, or is that a secret?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Well, as I said we will relase a lot of new tutorials. We might also do a few giveaways in the future, but that is not sure yet.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: Sounds cool. What kind of stuff do you guys usually give away?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: In our last contest we usually gave away gaming-related stuff, obvious :P. But for the next one it will be similar stuff, so it is going to be gaming stuff.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: What kind of gaming stuff? Memberships, gift codes, accounts, or physical stuff?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: We might give away money also. The gaming stuff is related to xbox codes, memberships for different games and maybe even the games themselves.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: That sounds pretty cool. Who usually buys that stuff to give away? Do all the members chip in or is it one person?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: We all give something away. It is from the whole group. We don't do it individually, but as a group.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=white][b]+Entity[/b][/color][/url]: A great team you have there. Any closing comments to kick the New Year off?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=67718][color=#FFF150][b]PubMaster[/b][/color][/url]: Just want to wish everyone a happy New Year. I hope all your wishes come true in 2013. Also, I would like to thank you for this interview, it was my pleasure doing this. Also would like to thank some members which helped me over time to become more HQ and they are good friends:
Aiir, Astonish, +Pirate, Touch, Cody, Allelujah, Dezinated, Bullet, Skill & Mendacious
[/spoiler]

[size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][color=white]Interview[/color] [color=white]-[/color] [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=252][color=#FFF150]HackerCraft![/color][/url][/font][/size]
[spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: Hello all, and welcome to the 124th edition of the HF News! Today, I've decided to interview the more active members of the HackerCraft community that were available for an interview. Hopefully you enjoy, and apologies in advance to all of those who dislike Minecraft.

[color=white][b][u]TheCompany (owned by Bay(stagdan) and Genuine(Genbti))[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: Genuine, do you feel being a staff member on HF has an effect on your HC life? If so, how and why? Also, how do you manage your time to be active on both HF and HC?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=646916][color=#FFF150][b]Genuine[/b][/color][/url]: The only effect I can think of is people knowing who I am on HackerCraft because of HackForums. I didn't really have to commit to anything on HC for players to know who I am. As for maintaining my activity on both HF and HC, it's pretty simple. With the help from other staff members, I have a few hours of free time, which is mostly used to play HackerCraft with my friends.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: So Bay, being the owner of one of the largest factions on HC (TheCompany), you must have issues with unwanted visitors and attempted raids, especially since your coords are public. What's your best advice towards the prevention and response of attempted raids and how does TheCompany usually retaliate?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=434812][color=#FFF150][b]Bay[/b][/color][/url]: We have a lot of claimed land and whenever someone tries to raid us we kill them and try to raid them back. We all make sure we have good armor and weapons. We tend to use tactical strategies to kill others.

[color=white][b][u]Wolves (owned by Phytrix(firtlast) and Malevolent‚Ñ¢(xxRyuk))[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: Pyrostat, how do you think Omni is doing as a HC admin, considering he knew little to nothing about running a MC server when the server was first started, to running it by himself now? Is there any advice you'd give him to keep learning, or perhaps learn more competently? Anything you think he should do differently?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=935282][color=#FFF150][b]Le Pie[/b][/color][/url]: I believe Omni is doing fairly well as the admin for the Hackercrafter server.  I remember when I was an admin a year or so back, it was a tough job.  Had to try to appeal to everyone's needs and answer questions.  So, from my point of view he has been doing fairly well.  Though, I do believe he should be hiring some more active mods/admins that can help out newcomers. I also believe the fact that one cannot survive out in the server without a faction is terrible.  I would not know how to fix that, but something has to be done about it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: When did you first join HC, Epic, and how do you think it has changed since?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=874827][color=#FFF150][b]EpicXXCrushor[/b][/color][/url]: I first joined the server when Omni released the beta IP. At first, it was terribly laggy and full of people being assholes. The server has come a long way, although the lag is still relatively bad and the community could improve. There is still a lot of drama too, but hey, what's a server without it?

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: So Rage, what do you think makes a successful faction and which factions do you think have been successful and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1183390][color=#FFF150][b]Rage‚Ñ¢[/b][/color][/url]: Well first of all, Wolves is defintely and a successful faction, TheCompany is also. What makes a good faction is good members, having roles, and having a lot of fun. It is great to be in a faction as the safety is much greater and it is much more fun. Wolves for example, has a base, has done raids, and has good members. The Company has been successful by having great members, doing contests and everything alike. Some factions recruit, as some are invite-only. Another thing that makes a faction great is establishing your allies and enemies. Being a trusted faction helps too. A example would be selling to members. Having some sort of XP farm is great for a faction. #WolvesOut

[color=white][b][u]Sinster (owned by Post(Blueo_O) and Skeetz(Yellow123))[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: What plugins and features do you think make HC so successful, Yellow? What else would you like to see added to the server?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=721655][color=#FFF150][b]Skeetz[/b][/color][/url]: I would like to see some more plugins that add more the the server, For example, I loved the arena plugin. I think if there were more things to set HC apart from other servers it would bring more players back. Oh and I would love to see a plugin added to help out new players from having their base destroyed within the first day of them making it. Something like a small plot a non faction member could buy, but would only be limited to one, and it could cost around 2k IGM for that plot.

[color=white][b][u]NeonBible (owned by Yuno(WeeklyTroll))[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: Which members do you think make HC a more enjoyable place and why, Yuno
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1124239][color=#FFF150][b]Yuno[/b][/color][/url]: Genuine, and yourself. You both are always trying to improve the community whether through giveaways or just by helping people.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: Sacred, what do you think creates and maintains a stable economy for HC? Are there any things you think need to be changed, added or removed to create a better economy?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1262623][color=#FFF150][b]Sacred‚Ñ¢[/b][/color][/url]: In my point of view I believe that on HC, to maintain a stable economy, we need no lag (NoLag plugin), more friendly users, stable and more managed PVP and unique factions. Some issues that I know almost everyone agrees with is the lag issues, which is better, although still an issue. There are some hours when the server is perfect and no lag, but as of lately I believe the lag has been ridiculous. Overall I do enjoy HC and believe to create a better economy we need to get a more stable server, advertise it more, and manage the lag issues to an extent where it's not considered an issue. I personally love HC and happy that it was created but just think those are some of the issues that could be addressed to improve the server.

[color=white][b][u]Mist (owned by The Milkshake Man (Aramis_Vei))[/u][/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1018876][color=white][b]Phytrix[/b][/color][/url]: So The Milkshake Man, you own a one-man faction after moving from a large faction with many members. Why did you decide to do this, and do you think working as an individual is better or worse, and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=569625][color=#FFF150][b]The Milkshake Man[/b][/color][/url]: I have trust issues. I wanted my own faction to claim my own land, really. Farms I have built have always been raided after I share the location with someone, and I didn't want to deal with that anymore. Having my own faction is  by far more difficult, but I believe it was worth it. I enjoy the solitude of my own faction, as only people you trust can betray you. Working as an individual has it's own advantages and disadvantages. You need to everything yourself, but you don't have to worry about someone else destroying your hard work.
[/spoiler]
posts.subject: [1/1/13] - HF News - New Years Edition

posts.message:
[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZig[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]It's Raidi[/color][color=#FFF150]ng Season![/color][/b]
It's been a very eventful week in relation to the destruction and downfall of many Hackercraft factions, with various raids, large and small, taking part throughout the week. Enderborn were raided twice this week: the first time by Wolves and NeonBible with the assistance of TheCompany. Enderborn's base had many vulnerabilities in its half-obby build and small parts of unclaimed land, making it a witherless raid (for once)! The second time was only a day later by Wolves. TheCompany were raided by Reapers and Reaperz (a brother of Reapers) by the use of a wither. Reapers were subsequently revenge-raided by TheCompany not long after, in their newly settled base stolen from Mist, which was stolen from TERROR. CHAD were raided earlier in the week by TheCompany with the assistance of a wither. It seems CHAD just can't get a break! Enderborn raided Quantum earlier in the week resulting from a 'scamming' incident. It seems this week has been huge for raids, and as some factions stock up for future raids and sending their minions adventuring, there may be a lot more to expect in the coming week. At least, Wolves have some raids in mind. ü§≠

[b][color=white]New Years' [/color][color=#FFF150]Celebrations[/color][/b]
In the festive mood we're all in (or at least, most of us), a lot of members have celebrated their New Years with HackerCraft members and festive events. The most discussed of which would be morchid's firework display, which he's been stocking up for for a fair while. Sadly, recording confusion led to the event most likely not being caught on camera, although those who were there enjoyed the display a lot. Thanks morchid! On another note, Enderborn are hosting a P0W3R (the HackerCraft rank, not HF P0W3R) upgrade contest. The thread can be seen [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3131377][b]here[/b][/url], and be sure to nominate or nominate a friend of yours if you're already upgraded. TheCompany's scavenger hunt finally ended, with a bunch of members from Quantum finding the Christmas tree loaded and crowded with goodies. Sadly, it seems Enderborn took a lot of this, and then it seems that Wolves took a lot of it off Enderborn, although good work, regardless. TheCompany also hosted a New Years PvP competition, in which the winner would be granted a double chest full of enchanted books, although it seems no one has yet to claim this prize. There were also various giveaways from different factions and individuals.

[b][color=white]Misc. [/color][color=#FFF150]News[/color][/b]
[list]
[*] Pyrostat hosted a house party earlier in the week, in which most of Wolves and TheCompany attended. Nothing like some light TNT to finish a good house party, though. You can read more [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3135428][b]here[/b][/url].
[*] Anonymoose were introduced into HackerCraft. You may view their information thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3137210][b]here[/b][/url].
[*] Star also joined HackerCraft, led by Dextra. You may view their recruitment thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3122376][b]here[/b][/url].
[*] Star are attempting to mine up TERROR's old base. Good luck... ;)
[*] Enderborn joined the faction list too! Although, I'm sure most would agree it feels like longer. Check out their thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=3132740][b]here[/b][/url].
[*] Paul. H, a member of MyBB Support, joined HackerCraft and HF! If you see him in game, shoot him a hello.
[*] SethBling, a very well known YouTuber, popped in two or three times this week to introduce himself. It's still unknown whether this was really him, or whether his account was compromised.
[/list]

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZjb[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]Dead Spa[/color][color=#FFF150]ce 3 Demo[/color][/b]
EA announced that Dead Space 3 Demo will drop this month, with Xbox getting exclusive early access. Xbox players can download the demo a whole week before anyone else gets their hands on it, however you must sign up at the Dead Space 3 Demo website right [url=http://demo.deadspace.com/]here[/url]. "The demo sees Isaac Clarke and co-op companion John Carver heading to the icy planet of Tau Volantis, where the duo experience the terror of pointy Necromorphs lurking around every corner. You can play solo with Isaac or in co-op with Carver." The demo is set to be out on the 22nd of January while the full game will be out on February 5th, 2013.¬†

[b][color=white]2012 Slides [/color][color=#FFF150]into 2013[/color][/b]
As the annual calendar rollover is here, gaming news falls short as everyone is on their Christmas and New Year breaks. I hope everyone had a great 2012 and if not, 2013 will be much better. Bring on the 2013 games! In the next edition, I will be brining more new and exciting content for the readers of the HF News. If you want to submit ideas, please let me know by posting or by sending me a private message.

[b][color=white]Video of [/color][color=#FFF150]the Week[/color][/b]
Gaming speed art at its best. It shows some of the best game characters this year!
[align=center][video=youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z2EWsWvp29o[/video][/align]

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZk1[/img][/align]
[b][color=white][color=white]Russia's Adopti[/color][color=#FFF150]on Bill Signed[/color][/color][/b]
Russia's President Vladimir Putin signed a bill that will not allow US families to adopt Russian children. The bill is officially set in motion on New Year's day. This raises concerns for many US families who adopt foreign babies, because it is one of the most popular countries to adopt from. The U.S. State Department publicly stated that they are disappointed with the bill and they "are further concerned about statements that adoptions already underway may be stopped and hope that the Russian government would allow those children who have already met and bonded with their future parent to finish the necessary legal procedures so that they can join their families." Many American families who were planning to adopt are saddened by this chain of events that has occurred.

[b][color=white]Prime Minister Cameron has[/color][color=#FFF150] a Positive Outlook[/color][/b]
World news usually covers something morbid or negative, but British Prime Minister David Cameron has stated that Britain is moving forward in a positive direction on all pertinent issues. He says that this positivity will carry forward into 2013. Cameron claimed that his governing body was in a hurry to continue with deficit reductions and government reforms on large budget items. "We can look to the future with realism and optimism. Realism, because you can't cure problems that were decades in the making overnight. There are no quick fixes and I wouldn't claim otherwise. But we can be optimistic too because we are making tangible progress."

[b][color=white]Indian Rape [/color][color=#FFF150]Slave Dies[/color][/b]
An Indian woman's rape had previously stirred up protests that reached national debate. The women's injuries resulted in her death this Saturday. This has sparked some more outrage, and the government has promised to deal with the situation adequately. The woman was a young medical student, and she died as a result of brain damage and other internal harm. A lot of sex crimes in India are not met with Justice. The Prime Minister has spoken words that suggest that will change by stating, "I hope that the entire political class and civil society will set aside narrow sectional interests and agenda to help us all reach the end that we all desire - making India a demonstrably better and safer place for women to live in."

[b][color=white]New Year's [/color][color=#FFF150]Eve Stampede[/color][/b]
The Ivory Coast, a French speaking West African country, began mourning today as the 2013 celebrations brought not only a bang, but a few crunches too. The New Year's Eve celebrations left at least 60 dead and dozens injured in Abidjan, the largest city of this country. Dozens were wounded in the celebrations and evacuated by rescue workers, while hundreds of others made their way to hospital on their own terms. The average age of those left dead were 18, ranging from extremely young to mid-aged, although primarily young adults or older teens. This three day mourning period will hopefully give some relief to the affected families as official investigations launch.

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZkU[/img][/align]
[b][color=white]Anon[/color][color=#FFF150]ymous[/color][/b]
Collective hacking group named as 'Anonymous' issued a new warning to the world this New Year. They issued a statement with a warning -'Expect Us 2013'- to the world last week. They included a video in this statement that displays the take-downs and exploits done by team Anonymous during 2012 that includes the shutdown of U.S. Department of Justice, the FBI, Universal Music and the Motion Picture Association of America's Web sites that protested against file-hosting site such as [removed]. The video also includes Anonymous' statements against Syrian government websites & "cyberwar" against the Israeli government in protest of government attacks on Gaza.

[b][color=white]Face[/color][color=#FFF150]book[/color][/b]
A new exploit was found by an I.T student on New Year's eve. The report says that Jack Jenkins, I.T student in U.K discovered an exploit on Facebook which allowed him to see other people's private messages. The exploit is that, by simply changing the ID number displayed in the message's confirmation URL, you can view messages, photos attached & not only that, you can also delete the message. Facebook shut down the service for few hours fixing it. The next morning it was officially informed as, "We are working on a fix for this issue now, and in the interim we have disabled this app on the Facebook Stories site to ensure that no messages can be accessed."

[b][color=white]You[/color][color=#FFF150]Tube[/color][/b]
YouTube returned to Pakistan after a ban of three months. YouTube was unavailable to many people from Pakistan as a result of this ban. The ban was due to the refusal of YouTube to take down a video. The Pakistan Government banned YouTube on September 19, 2012. The video, 'Innocence of Muslims', depicted the prophet Muhammad as a buffoon. However, after the ban was lifted, Pakistan Government officials learned that the video is still being hosted by YouTube, so Raja Pervez Ashraf, Pakistan's Prime Minister is to order their ISPs to re-ban YouTube.

[b][color=White]Ap[/color][color=#FFF150]ple[/color][/b]
With ongoing patent battles between Apple and Samsung, one of the patent suits have been pulled back by Apple. The patent suit on Samsung Galaxy's S3 mini has been pulled off with an agreement that Samsung will not be marketing anymore in U.S. "Apple will agree to withdraw without prejudice its request to include the Galaxy S III Mini in this case given Samsung's representation that it is not making, using, selling, offering to sell, or importing that product into the United States," added Apple in their filling. Meanwhile, an Apple Store in Paris was robbed on New Year's eve at 6 p.m closing time. The masked thieves were heavily armed with guns as they rushed into the store and robbed goods, and loaded them into their truck. The operation took about 40 minutes. Reports says that it was goods worth of $1.32 million.

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZlR[/img][/align]
[b][color=White]Psy To End 'Gangnam Style' [/color][color=#FFF150]On New Year's Eve[/color][/b]
This year, Psy went from being almost completely unknown outside of South Korea to being one of the most widely known pop stars in the world, with his song 'Gangnam Style' being the first video to reach one billion views on YouTube. He stated in an interview with MTV News: "[i]Being in Times Square on New Year's Eve is already special ‚Äî it's the biggest stage in the universe ‚Äî plus it's my birthday, so, with all that, it may be the ending of 'Gangnam Style,' I mean, what better way to do it? It's my biggest and most meaningful birthday. "The song became too popular, and so you start to have some concern about its life period," he said. "I'm really working hard on a new single right now, and I'm not saying ['Gangnam'] is ending on 'Dick Clark' ‚Äî I still have a lot of invitations to perform it ... I'll be in Paris, and in February I got invited to perform in China, and I've still got to do promo. So let me say that in America I need a new single because 'Gangnam Style' got too popular, so I've got to write a new single.[/i]"¬†

[b][color=White]Green Day to [/color][color=#FFF150]Return in 2013[/color][/b]
Singer Billie Joe Armstrong landed himself in rehab to deal with 'unspecified substance issues,' and will be returning to the band shortly. He announced in a statement: "[i]Dear friends ... I just want to thank you all for the love and support you've shown for the past few months,[/i]" wrote Armstrong. "[i]Believe me, it hasn't gone unnoticed and I'm eternally grateful to have such an amazing set of friends and family. I'm getting better everyday. So now, without further ado, the show must go on. We can't wait to get on the road and live out load! Our passion has only grown stronger.[/i]" So far, no information has been released about what substances Armstrong was using or how long he has spent in rehabilitation for the issues. The ban will continue their live tour on March 28th, 2013 starting in Chicago.

[b][color=White]Music Previews[/color][color=#FFF150] For 2013[/color][/b]
There are many rumors in the music industry about many new albums coming out early in 2013. Pearl Jam says that they have a handful of songs already recorded, but they are still unsure on when they will release a new album. Mariah Carey and Cher will both be releasing new records in March. Eminem is stepping back into the spotlight again and will be releasing several new records in the Spring. Ozzy Osbourne will strike up Black Sabbath for another album that is predicted to be absolutely amazing, or amazingly horrible according to the Huffington Post. Only time will tell which of these rumors come true and who will shine in 2013.¬†

[b][color=White]Music [/color][color=#FFF150]Videos[/color][/b][spoiler=]
[b][color=White]Most Popular Music Video of the Week[/color][/b]
[video=youtube]http://youtu.be/vNoKguSdy4Y[/video]

[b][color=#FFF150]User Suggested Videos[/color][/b]
[video=youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lvJRmdN9iyU[/video]
[video=youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lALU0EhT2vE[/video][/spoiler]

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZom[/img][/align]
[color=white]This is basically my own little corner to type up my thoughts and some standpoints on different topics.[/color]
[b][color=#FFF150]---[/color][/b]
Hope you all enjoy this edition and have had a Happy New Year!
Many fantastic things will be coming this year, and I wish you all the best!

[align=center][img]http://puu.sh/1HZsR[/img][/align]

[color=#FFF150]"What are you looking forward to, this holiday season?"[/color]

[color=white][i]"The only thing I look forward to during the holidays, is family time. My family 
had been through a lot, and as a result we're much closer then most 
families. We don't celebrate Christmas or anything like that, but during the 
holidays we just gather, my mother, siblings, and sometimes close friends, 
and just eat together. I find time together is richer then any material thing.
A smile or hug is much grander then new shoes, or handfuls of money. 
Family time is what I look forward too, nothing can brighten up my day, like
my family together, happy. "[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=879431][i]-Pali[/i][/url]

[align=right][i]"My holiday season was great! I received a great deal of 
presents, surprising, and ate a load of food! What could someone want 
more than time with their family? I got exactly what I wanted; some good 
old quality time with the family, watching movies, playing board games, and 
just telling stories. Happy holidays to all!"[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1256905][i]-Kenny West[/i][/url][/align]

[i]"This holiday season I looking foward to speand as much time as I can, 
with my family, friends and relatives. I want those holidays to be diffrent as 
the others in the past when all the Christmas Spirit for me were the presents. 
This time will be different, no more fancy presents only handmade presents 
full of love. Happy Holidays."[/i]
[url=url][i]-name[/i][/url]

[align=right][i]"Yes I did get what I wanted, I got all the gifts (mostly electronics) 
and what not but the real gift was to be with my brother who was in college for 
a year and I haven't been able to see him. Christmas at my house, was wonderful."[/i]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1294312][i]-Ove—èlo—èd[/i][/url][/align]

The topic for next week is "What time of year is your favorite? Why?"[/color]

[color=#FFF150]To send in your entries for the next edition, PM [url=http://goo.gl/FzyrO]Sir[/url].[/color]
